topic.title: Three Control Plane Node Disaster Recovery

abstract.shortdesc: In this scenario, all control plane nodes are destroyed which need to be rebuilt or replaced.

body.p: In this scenario, all control plane nodes are destroyed which need to be rebuilt or replaced.

section.title: Restore from a Swift backup:
section.p: Restoring from a Swift backup is not possible because Swift is gone.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Disable the default backup job(s) by editing the following file:~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible/roles/freezer-jobs/defaults/activate.yml
Set the value for freezer_create_backup_jobs to false:# If set to false, We wont create backups jobs. freezer_create_backup_jobs: false

Deploy the control plane nodes, using the values for your control plane node hostnames:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --limit <control_plane_hostname1>,<control_plane_hostname2>,<control_plane_hostname3> -e rebuild=True
For example, if you were using the default values from the example model files your command would look like this:ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --limit helion-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt,helion-ccp-c1-m2-mgmt,helion-ccp-c1-m3-mgmt -e rebuild=True The -e rebuild=True is only used on a single control plane node when there are other controllers available to pull config data from. This will cause the Vertitca database to be reinitialized, which is the only choice if there is not additional control nodes.

Restore the MySQL backup on the first controller node.
List out the Freezer jobs:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible fzc job-list --all
Example output, with the relevant backup job in bold:$ fzc job-list --all +----------------------------------+-----------------------+------------------------------------------+-----------+--------+-------+--------+------------+ | job_id | client-id | description | # actions | status | event | result | session_id | +----------------------------------+-----------------------+------------------------------------------+-----------+--------+-------+--------+------------+ | f96d59d7ded54c3c86da91474c04db21 | deployer | HLM Default: deployer restore from SSH | 7 | stop | | | | | 452627a7fd864a0ba9b11bae349f1894 | deployer | HLM Default: deployer restore from Swift | 7 | stop | | | | | 2293f1ab5022473784b49ea0292034a4 | helion-ccp-c1-m1-host | HLM Default: mysql restore from Swift | 1 | stop | | | | | 6105b8d1273346f98a7bd87a666005fc | helion-ccp-c1-m2-host | HLM Default: mysql restore from Swift | 1 | stop | | | | | cc77a6bd53cc45abbb9cb7120f0a6227 | helion-ccp-c1-m1-host | HLM Default: swift restore from SSH | 1 | stop | | | | | c234674860694802b5a50c6eec1cd286 | helion-ccp-c1-m2-host | HLM Default: mysql restore from SSH | 1 | stop | | | | | 38b4d22ee93c464e91afe44e99d17f33 | helion-ccp-c1-m1-host | HLM Default: mysql restore from SSH | 1 | stop | | | | | 00dc0231e83a4ea58bd8c53455bd059b | helion-ccp-c1-m1-host | HLM Default: swift restore from Swift | 1 | stop | | | | +----------------------------------+-----------------------+------------------------------------------+-----------+--------+-------+--------+------------+
Run the mysql restore from SSH job for your first controller node, replacing the job_id with your:freezer-scheduler job-start -j <job_id>

You can monitor the restore job by connecting to your first controller node via SSH and running the following commands:ssh <first_controller_node> sudo su tail -n 100 /var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log
Log back in to the lifecycle manager.
Log back in to the first controller node and move the following files:ssh <first_controller_node> sudo su rm -rf /var/lib/mysql/* cp -pr /tmp/mysql_restore/* /var/lib/mysql/
Log back in to the lifecycle manager and bootstrap MySQL:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts percona-bootstrap.yml
Verify the status of MySQL:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts percona-status.yml

Re-enable the default backup job(s) by editing the following file:~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible/roles/freezer-jobs/defaults/activate.yml
Set the value for freezer_create_backup_jobs to true:# If set to false, We wont create backups jobs. freezer_create_backup_jobs: true
Run this playbook to deploy the backup jobs:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts _freezer_manage_jobs.yml
